House Tassel, Victor Horta, 1893: Brussels
Metro Stations, Hector Guimard, 1900: Paris
Parc Guëll, Antonio Gaudì, (1900 - 1914): Barcelona
Casa Mila, Antonio Gaudì, (1905 - 1910): Barcelona
Sagrada Familia, Antonio Gaudì, 1883: Barcelona
Stock Exchange, Hendrik Petrus Berlage, (1897 - 1898): Amsterdam
Glasgow School of Art, Charles Rennie Mackintosh, (1896 - 1899), (1906 - 1909): Glasgow
Willow Tea Rooms, Charles Rennie Mackintosh, 1903: Glasgow
Hill House, Charles Rennie Mackintosh, (1902 - 1904): Helensburgh, Scotland
"Majolikahaus", Otto Wagner, (1898 - 1899): Vienna
Secession Building, Ernst Maria Olbrich, (1897 - 1898): Vienna
Postal Savings Bank, Otto Wagner, (1904 - 1906): Vienna
Goldman and Salatsch Tailorshop, Adolf Loos, (1908 - 1910): Vienna
Haus Steiner, Adolf Loos, 1910: Vienna
School of Art, Henry van de Velde, 1904: Weimar
AEG Turbine Factory, Peter Behrens, 1909: Berlin
Fagus Factory, Walter Gropius and Adolf Meyer, 1911: Alfeld, Germany
Monadnock Building, Burnham and Root, (1891 - 1893): Chicago
Wainwright Building, Dankmar Adler and Louis Sullivan, (1890 - 1891): St. Louis
Guaranty Building, Dankmar Adler and Louis Sullivan, (1894 - 1895): Buffalo
Wright Home and Studio, Frank Lloyd Wright, 1889: Oak Park, IL
Ward Willits House, Frank Lloyd Wright, 1902: Highland Park, IL
Larkin Building, Frank Lloyd Wright, (1904 - 1906): Buffalo
Unity Temple, Frank Lloyd Wright, 1906: Oak Park, IL
Robie House, Frank Lloyd Wright, 1909: Chicago
Imperial Hotel, Frank Lloyd Wright, (1915 - 1922): Tokyo, Japan
Cittá Nuova, Antonio Sant'Elia, 1914: Project
Glass Pavilion, Bruno Taut, 1914: Cologne
Schröder House, Gerrit Rietveld, 1924: Utrecht
Friedrichstrasse Skyscraper, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, 1921: Project
Concrete Office Building, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, 1923: Project
Bauhaus, Walter Gropius, 1926: Dessau
Masters‘ houses, Walter Gropius, Carl Fieger, Ernst Neufert, 1926: Dessau, Bauhaus Building
Tugendhat House, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, (1928 - 1930): Brno
Exhibition Pavilion, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, 1929: Barcelona
"Cloud Hanger", El Lissitzky, 1925: Project
Tower for the III International in Moscow, Vladimir Tatlin, (1919 - 1920): Project
